title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 656.1 - Standards
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 656.1 - Standards

State Regulations

Sewage passing through a marine toilet equipped with a
chlorinator or chemical treatment facility from a watercraft underway in waters
of the State shall be deemed treated if the undiluted effluent meets the
following standards: Items

Specifications
1. Floating solids; settleable solids

Removal of substantially all floating and
settleable solids which are readily visible and attributable to sewage. 2. Suspended solids

Not more than 50 parts per million. 3. 5-day biochemical and chemical oxygen demand. Not more than 50 parts per million. 4. Organisms of the coliform group

The median MPN value in any series of samples shall
not be in excess of 50 per 100 milliliters. All other sewage or sewage effluent discharged from
watercraft shall be deemed untreated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
656.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
